subject: Public Speaking
title: The Inoculation Effect
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Inoculation Effect.

hook.text: Warn audiences about counterarguments before opponents present them.

buildup.text: Inoculation exposes weak counterarguments so audiences reject them.

discovery.text: Like vaccines, small doses of opposition build resistance.

twist.text: Inoculated audiences are much harder to persuade by opponents.

climax.text: Pre-emptive refutation is one of the most powerful techniques.

quiz.question: What does inoculation do?
options: Pre-exposes to weak counterarguments for resistance
